name: Tejas Yogesh Pawar
summary: Data scientist with a strong foundation in Python, ETL, Experimental Design, and Machine Learning for analyzing business needs, executing process improvements, and supporting decision-making, with a track record of successful project completion.

work_authorization.status: Authorized to work in the United States
work_authorization.details: Currently on F1 STEM OPT, eligible to work for any employer for 3 years without sponsorship.
work_authorization.sponsorship_preference: Would appreciate visa sponsorship if possible.
work_authorization.employment_type: Open to full-time or contract-based opportunities.

masters.degree: Master of Science in Applied Data Analytics
coursework: Designing and Implementing a Data Warehouse
Advanced Machine Learning and Neural Networks

responsibilities: Teaching Assistant for CS 699 Data Mining and DS 210 Programming for Data Science, responsible for grading, leading problem-solving sessions, and guiding students on R, Python, Rust, and Java projects.
Developed and fine-tuned a RoBERTa-based NLP model to classify student-submitted reports as AI-generated or human-written, enhancing academic submission integrity.
Developed and deployed a real-time sentiment analysis model for customer emails using NLP and Hugging Face's BERT, achieving 85% accuracy and reducing CRM workload by 15%.
Led the development of 'Customer Happiness Meter,' improving customer engagement and marketing strategies by 35%.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to implement ML models, MS SQL, and ETL pipelines.

Devised Power BI dashboards to effectively communicate technical findings to non-technical stakeholder via engaging presentations, ensuring alignment with responsible growth initiatives and building strong professional relationships.
Conducted A/B tests in Python to evaluate marketing campaign conversion rates, generating an additional $1.3 million in revenue.
Preprocessed 100GB+ of data using Python, improving model training time by 15%.
Optimized AutoML and Explainable AI algorithms, reducing time complexity by 20% and automating 80% of processes.
Developed interactive Power BI dashboards for financial monitoring, reducing response time for 30+ clients.

projects.title: Personal Assistant Conversational Q&A Chatbot
description: Engineered and deployed a personal assistant chatbot utilizing OpenAI's GPT-3.5 Turbo model, showcasing proficiency in natural language processing, model integration, and deploying AI solutions to production environments.

Implemented end-to-end machine learning workflows—including data preprocessing, API development, and backend integration on Hugging Face Spaces—demonstrating expertise in building scalable machine learning applications.

projects.title: Text To Image Generation App
description: Fine-tuned the Stable Diffusion XL model using a specialized science diagrams multimodal dataset, enhancing its efficiency for accurate image generation, deployed the model via Amazon SageMaker for robust scalability.
Developed an iOS app with Xcode integrating this advanced AI model for seamless text-to-image conversions.

projects.title: Identification of Bullying Victims Using Data Mining Techniques
description: Demonstrated expertise in R programming and data mining by effectively reducing a complex dataset of 204 attributes to 31 essential features using LASSO and ANOVA F-test, significantly improving the predictive accuracy.
Skillfully applied hyperparameter tuning and rigorous model evaluation across nine machine learning models, favoring a logistic regression model for its balanced accuracy across classes.

projects.title: Digital Logistic System: The Next Generation Transport System - Robotics
description: Developed a line-following robot for the Digital Logistic System (DLS), using Arduino, ultrasonic and infrared sensors, and C++ programming, showcasing skills in robotics and embedded system design.
Innovated the DLS project, integrating AI and machine learning with Python, MQTT for IoT communications, and ROS for simulations, to enhance logistics efficiency and reduce operational costs.

projects.title: Barbie With Brains
description: Engineered an interactive virtual assistant using an RNN (Recurrent Neural Network) model for speech recognition, seamlessly integrated into a toy to provide an educational and entertaining experience for children.
Incorporated features like storytelling, counting, word spelling, and reminder settings powered by Mycroft's API.

projects.title: Image Processing for Diabetic Retinopathy Prediction
description: Developed and validated a 52-layer deep MobileNetV2 convolutional neural network (CNN) model to process retinal images, achieving a detection and classification accuracy of 74.93% on the test dataset.
Implemented advanced image classification techniques to categorize retinopathy into five distinct stages: None, Mild, Moderate, Severe, and Proliferative Diabetic Retinopathy.

certifications: AWS Certified Machine Learning Engineer - Associate (in progress)

Coordinated food drives for hunger relief.
